page.title: 15Social Concern - Harborne(2)
page.content: Smoking is a danger to health and should be stopped. Some people smoke 40 or more cigarettes a day. After a while it restricts breathing, clogs tubes, becomes bronchitis & eventually can end up as lung cancer. Once people start it is difficult to stop. Some children were encouraged to smoke by their parents, others steal them from older brothers & sisters. Another concern is glue sniffing which is becoming a problem amongst young people. We have seen children of 14-16yrs glue sniffing near our school. They usually put some glue or something similar into a plastic bag, hold the bag over their mouth & breathe deeply. We have seen them do some strange & dangerous things,sometimes the police have been called.Effects of glue sniffing are sores around the mouth, internal bleeding & death.
